name: Manoj Jadav
msg:
Sir, while processing claims it is found that the system is automatically calculating the interest for the year 2017-18 on pressing F5, which is leading for excess payment. Contributions of 2016-17 are also not reflecting at AO level in some cases as a result short amounts is being crediting to member account. 
To improve the system speed finacle software may be adopted, which is used by leading banks in india, finacle is simple to use and very accurate and speed & uses less memory.

name: RAJENDRA PRASAD
msg:
Sir,

At the outset I have the feedback from many establishments that the unification of portal is doing a good job as far as integration is concerned.  However, some feedback for improvement I received is that, the PAN verification is not immediately done for new coverages. While entering details in Member->registration, the AADHAR verification is failed sometimes. Also for forceful coverage cases, the ADMIN portal is not sending user ID password to the mobile of the establishment.

name: RAJENDRA PRASAD

In continuation to the feedback just now I submitted, there is also some grievance that the bank payment interface between the portal and the banker is slow which resulted in the session getting timed out, which also may be looked into

Dear Sir,
It is very much necessary to introduce online claim facilities. There are many harassment for employees for submitting their claim. Now, this is the time for globalisation. People from different states face problem in submitting claim in another state. Secondly, now employees are facing huge problem in their name correction. Most of the time it is seen that, the name in the epfo system is not matching with aadhaar card. EPFO delays in such correction. Correction should be made online.

name: Nishanth Y
msg:
In the Homepage of www.epfindia.com, 
below EPFO at a glance
EPFO Schemes--> EDLI Scheme
Earlier, the EDLI calculation was based on 20 times the average salary (with a maximum cap of Rs.15,000 per month) plus 20% bonus.

Now, it is raised to 30 times the average salary and a bonus of 50% of (30 times average salary) subject to a maximum of Rs.1.5 lakh.
Though, the quantum amount Rs.6 lakhs is correct in the webpage. Benefit amount 20 times the wages needs to be replaced by 30 times the wages.

name: Hinalben Sharma
msg:
When we want to view our passbook at https://passbook.epfindia.gov.in/MemberPassBook/Login.jsp it asks for login. I have observed that major people forget this password. There is no facility to reset the password on this page and hence it becomes impossible to verify the passbook.

name: Suresh Pillai
msg: System does not bear any format for Settlement of Claim in accordance with Para 39B of the Employees' Pension Scheme 1995 i.e. whenever EPFO receives a claim for transfer of Cash Value of Pension under Para 39B of the EPS 1995 to an Establishment exempted from EPS 1995 like TATA MOTORS, cannot be done.  Instead, Form 10C has to be called for and to settle under Para 14 of the EPS 1995 which may be absolutely in contravention to the statutory provisions contained in Para 14 and Para 39B EPS 1995
